[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Edge case: Concurrent handshakes] [State corruption] Can two concurrent handshakes from the same peer cause state corruption in anti_replay_timestamps? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Edge case: Handshake retry] [Replay confusion] If a client retries a failed handshake with the same timestamp, is it incorrectly marked as replay? (Medium)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Edge case: Socket reuse] [Protocol confusion] Can socket reuse after failed handshake cause protocol state confusion in subsequent handshake attempts? (High)
[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Edge case: Peer ID collision] [Authentication bypass] Can different public keys hash to the same PeerId, causing authentication confusion? (Critical)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Edge case: Empty trusted peers] [Access control failure] Does empty trusted_peers set in Mutual mode correctly reject all connections, or is there a bypass? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Edge case: Multiple roles] [Role conflict] Can a peer have multiple contradicting roles in different network contexts, causing authorization confusion? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Rust: Panic safety] [Panic propagation] Can any panic in handshake code leave shared state (RwLock, HashMap) in inconsistent state? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Rust: Drop implementation] [Resource cleanup] Are Drop implementations properly handling cleanup of cryptographic material and network resources? (Medium)
